Uses of Class
powerwalk.tasks.Task

  • Packages that use Task 
    Package Description
    powerwalk  
    powerwalk.tasks  

    • Uses of Task in powerwalk

      Methods in powerwalk that return Task 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Task Starter.currentTask()
      returns the currently running task.
      Task Bot.getCurrentTask()
      Returns the Task that is currently being run by PowerWalk.
      Task Bot.getIdleTask()
      Returns the Task that is used when the Bot is idle.
      Task Bot.getNextTask()
      Returns the next Task on the Task Queue without removing it.
      Task Bot.retrieveTask()
      Polls the first task in the task Queue.
      Methods in powerwalk with parameters of type Task 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Bot.assignTask(Task task)
      Queues the given Runnable in the Bot.
      void Bot.setIdleTask(Task task)
      Sets a Task that is executed repeatedly as long as there are no other Tasks.

    • Uses of Task in powerwalk.tasks

      Subclasses of Task in powerwalk.tasks 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  RestTask
      Creates a Task that rests the local Player.
      class  ReturnTask
      Executes a given Task and then returns to the position you were before the Task was executed.
      class  StepTask
      Represents a Task that can be split in a number of similar tasks.
      class  TravelTask
      This Task travels to the given destination using all available methods.
      Methods in powerwalk.tasks that return Task 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Task TaskDeque.getFirst()
      Returns the first Task in the Deque.
      Task TaskDeque.getLast()
      Returns the last Task in the Deque.
      Task TaskRunner.getTask()
      Returns the Task object associated with this TaskRunner
      Methods in powerwalk.tasks with parameters of type Task 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void TaskDeque.append(Task t)
      Adds a Task to the end of this Deque.
      int Task.compareTo(Task t)
      Returns the difference in Priority between this Task and Task t
      void TaskDeque.prepend(Task t)
      Adds a task to the beginning of this Deque.
      Constructors in powerwalk.tasks with parameters of type Task 
      Constructor and Description
      ReturnTask(Task t)
      Creates a new ReturnTask that executes the given Task and then makes its way back to the original position.
      TaskRunner(Task t)
      Creates a new TaskRunner set to run the specified Task instance.
      Constructor parameters in powerwalk.tasks with type arguments of type Task 
      Constructor and Description
      TaskDeque(java.util.Collection<? extends Task> tasks)
      Creates a TaskDeque filled with the given tasks.
